item.title: Tom add a quote by John Fante
item.description: "It was a bad one, the Winter of 1933. Wading home that night through flames of snow, my toes burning, my ears on fire, the snow swirling around me like a flock of angry nuns, I stopped dead in my tracks. The time had come to take stock. Fair weather or foul, certain forces in the world were at work trying to destroy me." -- John Fante

item.title: Tom add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tom add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "The bus roared through Indiana cornfields that night; the moon illuminated the ghostly gathered husks; it was almost Halloween. I made the acquaintance of a girl and we necked all the way to Indianapolis. She was nearsighted. When we got off to eat I had to lead her by the hand to the lunch counter. She bought my meals; my sandwiches were all gone. In exchange I told her long stories. " -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Tom add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Think you're escaping and run into yourself. Longest way round is the shortest way home." -- James Joyce

item.title: Tom add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "I was a Flower of the mountain yes when I put the rose in my hair like the Andalusian girls used or shall I wear a red yes and how he kissed me under the Moorish wall and I thought well as well him as another and then I asked him with my eyes to ask again yes and then he asked me would I yes to say yes my mountain flower and first I put my arms around him yes and drew him down to me so he could feel my breasts all perfume yes and his heart was going like mad and yes I said yes I will Yes." -- James Joyce

item.title: Tom add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The first draft of anything is shit." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tom add a quote by Per Petterson
item.description: "I remember a lot of dreams. Sometimes they are hard to distinguish from what has really happened. That is not so terrible. It is the same with books." -- Per Petterson

item.title: Tom add a quote by William Kennedy
item.description: "But after awhile you stand up, wipe the frost out of your ear, go someplace to get warm, bum a nickel for coffee, and then start walkin' toward somewheres else that ain't near no bridge." -- William Kennedy

item.title: Tom add a quote by Colum McCann
item.description: "The world spins. We stumble on. It is enough." -- Colum McCann

item.title: Tom add a quote by Kevin Barry
item.description: "One might trouble one's dainty snout with a whiff of the taleggio displayed in an artisanal cheese shop, or take a saucer of jasmine tea and a knuckle of fennel-scented snuff at a counter of buffed Big Nothing granite. But there was a want in these ladies yet, and it was for the rude life of youth." -- Kevin Barry

item.title: Tom add a quote by Kevin Barry
item.description: "Tricky the paths a long love might follow, like the spiral down twists of a raindrop on a windowpane." -- Kevin Barry
